did.unittitle: Veterans Administration Brooklyn Regional Office Personnel Information Bulletins

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: United States. Veterans Administration. Regional Office (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.)

did.abstract: The Veterans Administration Brooklyn Regional Office Personnel Information Bulletins contains a run of newsletters from 1947–1964, spanning all but the final year of the regional office's existence. Bulletins were distributed by the Office of Personnel to keep employees informed of "Personnel Activities, Policies, and Programs."

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Felix J. Cuervo to the Long Island Historical Society in August 1965.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Bulletins are sequenced in roughly chronological order and are foldered in five-year periods.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The Veterans Administration Brooklyn Regional Office opened on May 5, 1947, as an office of the New York district. Its offices were originally located at 25 Ryerson Street in Clinton Hill and moved to 250 Livingston St in Downtown Brooklyn on July 7, 1952. On August 28, 1965, the Brooklyn office was consolidated with the New York Regional Office (located in Manhattan). The Brooklyn Regional Office was managed by A.B. Kelly (May 1947–January 1959) and T.A. Hurlbut (February 1959–August 1965).

The Personnel Information Bulletins were at various times edited by the Personnel Officer and the Assistant to the Personnel Officer. Identified editors include Junius Kurens (as early as December 1955–April 1956), Simon Esterowitz (May 1956–June 1958), Benjamin Ganchrow (July 1958–June 1961), and Felix J. Cuervo (September 1961–April 1964).

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: If digital surrogates exist, they should be used in place of the originals whenever possible.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Veterans Administration Brooklyn Regional Office Personnel Information Bulletins, CBHM.0027, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Received by the Long Island Historical Society in 1965, these bulletins were found-in-collection in 2023 and were processed, arranged, and described by Jake Gibson (November–December 2024).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of personnel information bulletins for the Veterans Administration Brooklyn Regional Office that were distributed from May 1947 through April 1964. Bulletins were distributed by the Office of Personnel to keep employees informed of "Personnel Activities, Policies, and Programs."

Topics covered by bulletins include (but are not limited to) changes to employee benefits and compensation; reduction in force plans; employee commendations; personnel changes; the impact of legislation on federal employees; information for veterans; holiday messages; workplace advice; and notices of social activities.
